subject: Leadership
title: Growth vs. Fixed Mindset
description: A 60-second lesson on Growth vs. Fixed Mindset.

hook.text: Two leaders fail. One says 'I'm not cut out for this.' The other: 'Now I know what to fix.' Same event. Different mind.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck's research: people with fixed mindsets believe talent is innate. Growth mindsets see ability as developable.

discovery.text: Growth-minded leaders embrace challenges, persist through setbacks, and see effort as the path to mastery.

twist.text: Nobody is purely growth or fixed. Mindset shifts by domain. A leader may be growth in strategy but fixed in creativity.

climax.text: Shift mindset by adding 'yet.' 'I can't do this' becomes 'I can't do this yet.' One word changes everything.

punchline.text: Talent sets the floor. Mindset sets the ceiling.

quiz.question: What defines a growth mindset?
options: Believing talent is fixed at birth
Seeing ability as developable through effort
